span.p: System Bay 1 houses from one to a maximum of 4 PowerMax bricks/PowerMax zbricks in PowerMax 8000 arrays. A PowerMax brick/PowerMax zbrick consists of an engine, DAEs, and a pair of SPS-es.
The difference between PowerMax bricks and PowerMax zbricks are:

ul.li: The base storage capacity is 53 TBu for PowerMax brick and 13 TBu for PowerMax zbricks
The I/O modules that provide host connectivity are Fibre Channel, iSCSI, and/or FICON (mixed systems only) for PowerMax bricks and FICON only for PowerMax zbricks.

span.p: In addition to the PowerMax brick/PowerMax zbrick components, System Bay 1 houses the InfiniBand interconnect and Ethernet switches. These are components specific to System Bay 1.
Accessible from the rear, there is a full-height, vertical Power Distribution Unit (PDU) on each side of the rack.

The System Bay 1 population starts at the bottom with SPS-es for Engine 1, followed by DAEs, Engine 1, SPS-es for Engine 2, then Engine 2. The population in the top half mirrors that at the bottom by starting with Engine 3, SPS-es for Engine 3, Engine 4, DAEs, and SPS-es for Engine 4 at the top of the rack.

Each PowerMax brick/PowerMax zbrick owns one and shares one DAE. Three fully populated DAEs therefore provide the storage capacity for two PowerMax bricks/PowerMax zbricks. The shared DAEs house universal spare drives that reside in dedicated drive slots.
